speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: Three.

speaker: GREY-HAIRED PLAYER
line: Give me two.

speaker: BALD PLAYER
line: Two.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Can I have five cards, please?

speaker: DEALER
line: Five? What, are you serious? Four is the limit. Let's see your ace.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: If Mr. Weems wants five... give him five.

speaker: DEALER
line: Dealer takes two.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: Four.

speaker: GREY-HAIRED PLAYER
line: Nah-uh.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: How much is that?

speaker: DEALER
line: Four grand keeps you in. You and your five shiny new cards.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: There's $4,000... and four more.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: Let's make this interesting. I'm raising you 15 large.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I wouldn't do that. This is all I need.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: You're going to need Depends after you see this hand.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Now we show each other our cards?

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: Four kings.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: That's a straight flush, right?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Beginner's luck.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: What the hell do you think you're doing?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Going home.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: No, no. Not so fast. We expect a chance to win some of our money back.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Guys, there's over $100,000 here.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: You're damn right there's over $100,000 there.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: $100,000 is all I need. Sorry. I had fun, though. Where can I cash out?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Guys, I think we're going up instead of down. .

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Guys... Guys, this is not what I meant by "cashing out"! Hey! Hey!

speaker: MULDER
line: Hello.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey, Mulder, it's me. What now?

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you in Chicago?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes, I'm in Chicago. I'm on the northeast corner of 7th and Hunter just like you asked. Only you're not here. So where are you?

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, around.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hey, nice outfit.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey. What's down there?

speaker: MULDER
line: Before you check out down there check out up there. Top two floors are leased to one Jimmy Cutrona whose name you might be familiar with.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Organized crime. The Bureau's been trying to build a racketeering case against him for the past few years. Gambling, extortion, murder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which is why last night there were two agents parked across the street in surveillance. They witnessed a man being thrown from Cutrona's

speaker: ROOF AT 10
line: 40 p.m. This man fell for 30 floors, plus the distance down this shaft, because these doors just happened to be open-- straight through, nothing but net.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ouch.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm guessing that's what he said. After, he got up, climbed out of here and scampered off into the night.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you keep saying "this man." Who is this man?

speaker: MULDER
line: No idea. He got away. The agents gave chase, but no clear description.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Was this basement thoroughly searched?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. Technically, falling 300 feet and surviving isn't a crime.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And your theory is?

speaker: MULDER
line: What if this man had some kind of special capability? Some kind of genetic predisposition towards rapid healing, or tissue regeneration?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, basically, what if we were looking for Wile E. Coyote? You're saying that he is invulnerable, right?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You know in 1998, there was a British soldier who plummeted 4,500 feet when his parachute failed and he walked away with a broken rib.

speaker: MULDER
line: What's your point?

speaker: SCULLY
line: My point is that if there's a wind gust, or a sudden updraft and, plus, if he landed in exactly the right way, I mean, I don't know. Maybe he just got lucky.

speaker: MULDER
line: What if he got really, really lucky? That's your big scientific explanation, Scully? I mean, how many thousands of variables would have to convene in just the right mixture for that theory to hold water?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, thousands.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Look at this. If this cart were on the platform when he hit, that would explain the condition of these wheels. And what if this whole thing had just enough give to save his life?

speaker: MULDER
line: We'd have to find him to ask.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah, we have to find him.

speaker: MULDER
line: Looks like maybe we've found part of him already.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think you're taking a flier here, Mulder. There's got to be at least 600 people with prosthetic eyes in the greater Chicago area.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, but only this one Henry Weems made an appointment this morning to get a new one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe he can't see his way to the door.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Scully. I'm feeling lucky.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Can you help me? It's an emergency.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Ma'am, we're not plumbers.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: I didn't say you were. I just want the damn water turned off so that I can go to work. Look, you've got to be stronger than me, right? Valve's under the sink.

speaker: MULDER
line: Your building super-- Henry Weems-- he isn't around?

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Mr. Dependable? Might as well wait for Jimmy Hoffa to show up.

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: You're turning it the wrong way.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Hey, Richie sweetheart, back in bed.

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: But, Mom...

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: "Buts" are for sitting and I want yours back in bed.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: He's right. Clockwise.

speaker: MULDER
line: I know that. Clockwise.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You okay, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, it's all right. My ass broke the fall. Guess who I found. Henry Weems, I presume?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Next time, leave the plumbing to a professional.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, uh... Oh, uh... You want to try this on for size, Cinderella?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Weems, why were you hiding in a vacant apartment?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Not hiding-- avoiding.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Avoiding whom?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: You people. Now that you found me let's just get it over with. No way am I testifying against Jimmy Cutrona.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Last night, Cutrona had you thrown off the roof of 1107 Hunter Avenue-- is that correct?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: You didn't hear it from me. I'm not letting you people move me to Muncie, Indiana, to milk cows.

speaker: MULDER
line: More to the point, you survived a, uh... 300-foot fall essentially un... harmed.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I don't know. Maybe... The wind was just right and I landed on a bunch of towels-- no biggie.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You got lucky?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Yeah, I guess, except... you should look at my... bruise.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Plus, I didn't get to keep my poker winnings.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So that's what you were doing there last night-- playing poker?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Cutrona thought I was cheating. I wasn't. But like I said, you didn't hear it from me.

speaker: MULDER
line: Must have been a high-stakes game, I imagine. Did you win a lot of money?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I don't know... A little.

speaker: MULDER
line: What is that? Did you make it?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Uh-huh. It's sort of a hobby.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mm-hmm. Mind if I...?

speaker: MULDER
line: Ah... That's craftsmanship. What does it mean?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: What do you mean "what does it mean?"

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, what's-what's...

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: It doesn't mean anything. I just sort of... I don't know.

speaker: MULDER
line: It's cause and effect.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: So, are-are we done here?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mr. Weems, can I ask you to reconsider testifying against Cutrona?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Nope. No way, Jose.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it would be in your best interest. He's tried to kill you once and he will undoubtedly do it again.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, we can protect you.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I'll take my chances.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, here's the plan, as I see it: we inform the Chicago field office about Weems, leaving it to them to secure his testimony, you change your clothes...

speaker: SCULLY
line: ... we fly back to D.C. by sunset and all is right with the world.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Scully, you're going to dump this case just as it's getting interesting.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Interesting," Mulder was when we were looking for Wile E. Coyote. Come on, Mulder, this guy just got lucky. There's no X-File here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe his luck is the X-File.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Stairs.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh... Car keys. Must have lost them when I fell.

speaker: MULDER
line: So, you get many of these?

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, uh, we've searched the entire building and there's no sign of Henry Weems. I'm guessing that he's on the run.

speaker: MULDER
line: Our dead man's name is Angelo Bellini a.k.a. "Angie the Animal." He's an enforcer for the Cutrona family and I don't think his visit was friendly.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You think that Weems could have killed him in self-defense?

speaker: MULDER
line: Skinny guy with no depth perception against a man nicknamed "The Animal"? I don't think so. You and I both know Weems didn't kill anybody. Besides, we were just gone for two minutes. This guy doesn't have a scratch on him. I'm thinking it was a heart attack.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What the hell happened here, Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Cause... and effect.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Meaning...?

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay, so... watch. So Bellini kicks down the door-- whaa gaa!-- poised to kill Weems, right? And just as he's about to pull the trigger a noise startles him... the buzzer-- when I buzzed to be let back in the apartment. So when he does pull the trigger, his aim is off, right? And he hits the lamp, which falls over and knocks over the ironing board, so as the bullet ricochets Weems dives over the sofa. Now, when Bellini goes for him he trips over the ironing board, bounces off the chair, flips end over end and his shoelace gets caught in the fan-- QED.

speaker: MULDER
line: CAUSE AND EFFECT: seemingly unrelated and unconnected events and occurrences that appear unrelated and random beforehand but which seem to chain-react in Henry Weems' favor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Dumb luck?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, he seems to have tapped into it somehow. He-he won big at poker; he-he survived getting thrown off a skyscraper... and now this.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hang on a second.

speaker: MULDER
line: Okay.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Hey. Your name's Richie, right?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: Yeah.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm Dana.

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: Hi.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why don't we, uh, head back to your room? I'm sure that's what your mom would want.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So I'm guessing you're a sports fan. Which one's your favorite?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: Well, it used to be basketball. But now the Bulls suck, so I think maybe baseball.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I like baseball, too. Did Henry make this for you?

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's pretty neat.

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: Yeah. He made it for me when I was in the hospital. He said... it's 'cause... everything happens for a reason... only just sometimes it's hard for us to see.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You went to the hospital because of your liver?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: It doesn't work so good. Police looking for Henry?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah. They just want to talk to him. Do you have any idea where he might have gone?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: Mm-mm. Since I got sick, he hardly ever goes out.

speaker: MULDER
line: Boy give you any leads?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He knows nothing.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, as to your theory...

speaker: MULDER
line: Mm-hmm?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Why would the world's most supernaturally lucky man work as a building superintendent? I mean, why doesn't he just run down to the Illinois state lottery, enter, and, you know, he'd win automatically?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: How you feeling, pal?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: I'm okay. The police are looking for you, though. How come?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Uh... you know-- you do folks a favor, wire the joint for free cable... don't worry about it. You going to be okay by yourself for a while?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: Where you going?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Something I got to do I've been putting off. You get some rest.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's it?... Got nothing else. Okay. Thank you.

speaker: MULDER
line: Henry Weems has no police record, I assume?

speaker: SCULLY
line: He has no record of any kind, Mulder. He doesn't earn enough in a year to file tax returns. He has no savings account, no checking account, no insurance. Doesn't even have a video rental card for that matter. He doesn't even have a driver's license. I mean, it's like he's intentionally stayed off the radar. He's retired from the world.

speaker: MULDER
line: Ever since December, 1989. When a commuter jet crashed into Lake Michigan carrying 21 passengers. There was one survivor.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Henry.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. That's how he lost his eye. Snowy night, Christmas rush. He'd been bumped from three previous flights before they finally found a seat for him on that fateful plane. Guess what seat number.

speaker: MULDER
line: On flight seven.

speaker: SCULLY
line: More good luck, you're saying?

speaker: MULDER
line: Call it good or bad, but maybe that's where it all started. What if a brand-new Henry Weems was plucked from the wreckage? One whose fortunes had been irrevocably, permanently changed? Before 1989, Henry held down a job for nine years at the train yard but after the accident, as you said it's like he just disappeared off the face of the earth. He severed ties with all his friends and moved out to Melrose Park.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, there are millions of reasons for that including survivor's guilt. I mean, what doesn't track for me is why Henry Weems would drop off the map just because he suddenly became incredibly lucky.

speaker: MULDER
line: What doesn't track for me is why he's resurfaced after all these years. Why he's suddenly decided to use his luck in this way.

speaker: MAURICE THE CLERK
line: All right. Take care of yourself, Brother.

speaker: CUSTOMER
line: Later.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Hey, what's the lottery up to?

speaker: MAURICE THE CLERK
line: $28 million.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I don't need that much.

speaker: MAURICE THE CLERK
line: You don't need that much. How much do you need, uh, Rockefeller?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: More like 100 grand.

speaker: MAURICE THE CLERK
line: Here goes. One dollar.

speaker: PUNK
line: These suck.

speaker: NEWSWOMAN ON TV
line: Police have confirmed that a Melrose Park building superintendent is wanted for questioning in a case some sources term an unusually vicious gangland slaying.

speaker: PUNK
line: You did it! You won 100 grand!

speaker: NEWSWOMAN ON TV
line: ... One source close to the case described it as a clear...

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Where do I collect the money?

speaker: MAURICE THE CLERK
line: They'll mail it to you. $8,200 a month for 12 months. Yeah!

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: That's too long.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: No, please. I wouldn't do that.

speaker: PUNK
line: Oh, baby. Oh, sweet baby.

speaker: MAURICE THE CLERK
line: Anything in the trash can is store property.

speaker: PUNK
line: Yeah, right. In your face.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: No, just throw it away. Something bad is going to happen.

speaker: PUNK
line: So long, suckers.

speaker: PUNK
line: I did it! I won! I won the lottery! 100 grand, fools. 100 grand!

speaker: PARAMEDIC
line: On three... One, two, three.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, let me get this straight. This is the man who initially won the money?

speaker: MAURICE THE CLERK
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: And once you and he ascertained that the accident victim was still alive this man fled on foot?

speaker: MAURICE THE CLERK
line: Mm-hmm.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Afterwards, the man who was hit by the truck handed you the lottery card, and said...

speaker: MAURICE THE CLERK
line: "Maurice, I want you to have this."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mm-hmm. Thank you, Mr. Albert. I think that will be all.

speaker: MAURICE THE CLERK
line: Thank you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For such a fortunate man a lot of unfortunate things happen in Henry Weems' wake.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe that's part of the package. Can't have one without the other.

speaker: SCULLY
line: So, Mulder, Henry Weems came here to buy a lottery ticket. Why?

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe it's like you said. Why wouldn't the luckiest man in the world enter the lottery? Actually, that's exactly what you said about an hour after you said it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, he's not in his place and he's not with Richie. You think he hid in there?

speaker: MULDER
line: He doesn't "hide," he "avoids."

speaker: SCULLY
line: Pretty damn well, I'd say. That thing must go all over the building, Mulder. I'll start with the roof if you want to start with the basement.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Hey... hey. Watch the rough stuff.

speaker: MULDER
line: Henry Weems... you're a hard man to track down.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I'm working here.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh? You and I are going to have a talk. Just sit right here and don't move, okay?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Tough guy.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Oh, crap. Not again.

speaker: NURSE
line: Let's get him up to OR 40. Coming through.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Does it hurt?

speaker: MULDER
line: Stings a bit. But I'll live.

speaker: MULDER
line: Come over here, Henry. I want to try something.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: What's that about?

speaker: SCULLY
line: I haven't a clue.

speaker: MULDER
line: Nine of clubs. You go.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: What for?

speaker: MULDER
line: I think you know.

speaker: MULDER
line: Uh, you win. Double or nothing.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whoo-hoo! Tough to beat.

speaker: MULDER
line: You win again.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, what does that prove?

speaker: MULDER
line: It proves that if we played this 10,000 times in a row he would win 10,000 times in a row. He's incapable of losing. How does it feel to be the luckiest man in the universe, Henry?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: It's a nightmare. You have no idea.

speaker: MULDER
line: No, no, I do, 'cause when you get lucky-- really, really lucky-- people around you tend to suffer. Is that right?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I think it's a balance thing. Something good happens to me and everybody else has to take it in the keister.

speaker: MULDER
line: So you've stayed close to home mostly, kept a low profile but recently you've been venturing out a little further. You played poker with those mobsters.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I figured they could stand the trimming. Bunch of goombah jerks... They got issues, man.

speaker: MULDER
line: You don't mind so much if a few criminals get hurt but then you went and you played the lottery.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I knew I shouldn't have done that. I needed the money.

speaker: MULDER
line: For what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: For Richie, right?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: It's the complications from his hepatitis. He's on every donor list they got. But he's got a rare blood type-- B-negative. And he's C-N.... something.

speaker: SCULLY
line: CMV negative. Cytomegalovirus.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: There's no way they're going to find a donor in time. There's a treatment program in England. 100 grand gets him in. It's experimental, but it's the best chance he's got now. Am I under arrest?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: However, you will need protection from Cutrona and his men.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I'd say they need protection from me.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm sorry, Mulder. That was utterly irresponsible. You're feeding the delusions of a man who has had three attempts made upon his life. You're supposed to be talking him into protective custody, not out of it.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'd agree with you if I thought his life was in danger.

speaker: MULDER
line: As it is, he's doing a better job on Cutrona's organization than the FBI. I'm wondering if we shouldn't make him an honorary agent.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you're putting an astounding amount of faith in coincidence and luck. Essentially, you're betting a man's life on it. And even if you believe in so-called lucky streaks you have to know they all eventually end.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Luckiest man in the world? Hell, Mulder, I just beat him.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Come on, Scully.

speaker: MULDER
line: Henry!

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: You're supposed to be resting.

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: I am resting.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Playing on the floor doesn't count. Don't you ever get tired of this thing?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: Henry said it's educational.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Yeah, well, I don't want you believing everything that Henry says.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Did you know the police are looking for him?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: Henry said it's no big deal.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: When did you see...?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: Mom, what's wrong?

speaker: MULDER
line: How's he doing?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, he's got a bruised rib and a black eye. It certainly could have been worse. And don't tell me he just got lucky.

speaker: MULDER
line: Far from it. Maybe what you said about streaks is right. It looks like his has just about run its course.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't mean to make light of his misfortune but it may have knocked some sense into his head. He's agreed to testify against Cutrona.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: What?

speaker: DOMINIC
line: Our guy from the justice department just called. They're filing a federal warrant this afternoon. This mook Weems...

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: This mook Weems was street pizza last I heard from you.

speaker: DOMINIC
line: He was. I don't know what it is. Maybe he has some special ability. He's impervious or something. Anyway, we can't get to him. They got cops all over the hospital.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: Who says we have to get to him?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: I want the toy Henry made me, Mom. Can you please go get it?

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Uh, sure, honey.

speaker: PARAMEDIC
line: We got to go.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: All right, Richie. I will bring it and I will follow you there. I will meet you at the hospital, okay?

speaker: RICHIE LUPONE
line: Mm.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Did you find her?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: You know Cutrona took her. He did it to keep me from testifying.

speaker: MULDER
line: And he's who we're focused on but there's no sign of a kidnapping, there's no ransom note.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: He's too smart for that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Which makes it very hard for us to obtain a search warrant.

speaker: SCULLY
line: We'll get one, though.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: When? Tomorrow? Next week? Could someone sit with him at least?

speaker: MULDER
line: Hold up, Henry. Henry, what if what I said before wasn't true? That your luck hasn't changed? Maybe all this is happening for a reason.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: So you're saying that Maggie getting taken is a good thing?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I'm saying that what looks like it might be bad luck may not be bad luck, but we can't tell yet. We're not in that position. We can't see the forest for the trees.

speaker: MULDER
line: How is he?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Not good. If we don't find a donor in the next few hours...

speaker: MULDER
line: Scully, what if everybody that becomes involved in Henry Weems' life somehow becomes an integral part of his luck, including you and I?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, you're speaking as if we're all trapped in one of those contraptions that he built.

speaker: SCULLY
line: What are you doing?

speaker: MULDER
line: Looking for Maggie Lupone. Luck is the overreaching force in this investigation. I say we roll with it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, let's call that a dry run.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yeah.

speaker: DOMINIC
line: Look who came calling.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I wanted to tell you personally that there's no hard feelings. I'm not testifying against you. Just let Maggie Lupone go.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: "Maggie"? I don't know anybody named Maggie. Do you know anybody named Maggie?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Fellas, don't jerk me around.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: Jerk you around? You tried to cheat me out of a hundred large, you kill Angie, you put Sal in the hospital-- I'm jerking you around?

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: I apologize for my choice of words. Please, just let her go. Her kid's really sick. I don't care what happens to me.

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: You'll care. By the time I'm finished, you'll definitely care.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Henry? Richie-- how is he?

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: Not that one. Use the small one.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Hey. Henry...

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Don't you hurt him you son of a bitch!

speaker: JOE CUTRONA
line: Shut her up.

speaker: MAGGIE LUPONE
line: Henry!

speaker: MULDER
line: What are the odds for Cutrona being a perfect match? A thousand-to-one? A million-to-one?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe higher. Maybe everything does happen for a reason... whether we see it or not.

speaker: MULDER
line: Maybe your luck is changing.

speaker: HENRY WEEMS
line: Maybe.
